results.title: Audacious
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Samantha Lang and Fiona Tuomy
results.brief_description:
Stella, a young woman bored with her husband’s bedroom behaviour, embarks on a daring journey to the other side of sexual satisfaction.
Cast features Dee Smart as Stella and John Polson as Tom.

results.title: Aucassin and Nicolette
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover and Lotte Reiniger
results.brief_description: An animated medieval fantasy, a delightful silhouette film, with colour background by master German animator Lotte Reiniger. Set against a background of castles and forest with Renaissance style music this enchanting tale recounts the love story of Aucassin and Nicolette.

results.title: Au revoir les enfants
results.creator_credit: Nouvelles Éditions de Films and Louis Malle
results.brief_description: In the words of the director himself, “Au revoir les enfants is drawn from the most dramatic experience of my childhood. In 1944, when I was eleven, I was boarding in a Catholic school near Fontainebleau. One of my classmates, who had arrived at the beginning of the year, intrigued me a great deal. He was different, secretive. I was getting to know him, learning to love him when, one morning, our little world fell apart. I have tried to rediscover that first, and most powerfull, friendship that was so abruptly destroyed; and my introduction to the absurdities of the adult world with its violence and prejudices.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nouvelles Éditions de Films and Louis Malle

results.title: Au Hasard Balthazar = Balthazar
results.creator_credit: Argos Films, Parc Film, Athos Film, Philippe Dussart and Robert Bresson
results.brief_description: Balthazar is a donkey which is born in a French village and whose life is spent in being a slave to his human masters. Over the donkey’s lifetime we witness the harsh realities of rural life, a life mostly hard and brutal and only occasionally made bearable by warmth or love. The humans who surround the donkey are themselves in pain but they fail to understand - or do not wish to see - the connection between themselves and the animal which they use and which they abuse. Only a young peasant girl attempts to love the animal and it is within the beauty and innocence of this relationship that something approaching religious transcendence is made possible. Robert Bresson, one of French cinema’s most important directors, spent his life working on films which explored the experiences of society’s most marginalised and vulnerable people - the unemployed, the criminal, the ill. In an ouvre remarkable for its compassion, “Au Hasard Balthazar” stands out as one of cinema’s most important humanistic visions. As we follow the cycle of birth, life, work and death as lived out by the donkey Balthazar, we experience the shock of recognition and we are aware of bearing witness to a profoundly sacred vision. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Au Coeur de la Vie = in the Heart of Life
results.creator_credit: Henry Deutschmeister, Robert Hossein, Paul de Roubaix and Robert Enrico
results.brief_description:
A dramatization of a short story by Ambrose Bierce set during the American Civil War in which a Confederate citizen stands on the scaffold, about to be hanged, and seems, by a series of miracles, to escape death. See also: The story ‘La Riviere de Hibou’ is available separately on 16mm in the NLA Collection (#0087311). See also: Interview with Robert Enrico about this work in ‘Le Desordre et Apres’ (X000659).

Credits: Producers, Henry Deutschmeister, Robert Hossein, Paul de Roubaix ; director, writer, Robert Enrico ; photography, Jean Boffety ; music, Henri Lanoe.
Cast: Roger Jacquet, Anne Cornaly, Anker Larsen.

results.title: Attraction of gravity
results.brief_description: The relationship of mass and distance to the force of gravity are explored by careful duplicating of Cavendish’s and Boy’s experiments. Understanding gravity helps us to explain the movements of the planets and the changes in weight of astronauts as they land on the moon. Suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.title: Attiuk
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Pierre Perrault and Rene Bonniere
results.brief_description: To understand the life of the Montagnais, you have to walk twelve days on snowshoes as far as Lake Musquaro in search of the caribou, following a dream contained within the skins of the drum that the elders patiently craft, like a canoe. The hunters hunt the caribou, which provide the skins for their drums which give them their dreams, which brings them the caribou.
